data.title: University of Connecticut Athletics
data.meta_description:
Cam Spencer (12) Guard  - 2024 First Team All-BIG EAST

2024 NCAA Final Four All-Tournament Team

2024 Associated Press BIG EAST Newcomer of the Year



2023-24:


	First
data.text:
2024 First Team All-BIG EAST

2024 NCAA Final Four All-Tournament Team

2024 Associated Press BIG EAST Newcomer of the Year

2023-24:

First Team All-BIG EAST

Associated Press BIG EAST Newcomer of the Year

NCAA Final Four All-Tournament Team

Started all 40 contests and averaged 14.3 points, 4.9 rebounds and 3.6 assists per game

Ranked fifth in the NCAA with a 44.0 percent mark from 3-point range

Finished eighth in the country with a 3.6 assist/turnover ratio

Shot 91.1 percent from the free throw line to become UConn’s all-time career leader

Had eight games of at least 20 points

Scored a season-high 25 points and hit seven 3-pointers against MVSU (Nov. 14)

Went for 23 points, seven rebounds and six assists against No. 9 North Carolina in the Jimmy V Classic (Dec. 5)

Pumped in 23 points and hit five 3-pointers against St. John’s (Feb. 3)

Scored 17 points along with eight rebounds at No. 8 Marquette (March 6)

Dropped 20 points against St. John’s in the BIG EAST Tournament Semifinals (March 15)

Recorded his first career double-double in the Elite Eight, going for 11 points and 12 rebounds against Illinois (March 30)

Before UConn: District XIII Second Team… As a freshman, named to Patriot League All-Rookie Team.All-NABC with one season of eligibility remaining after spending last season at Rutgers and the three previous seasons at Loyola-Maryland…Taking advantage of extra season of eligibility granted by NCAA for those student-athletes who were affected by the pandemic… Outstanding long-range shooter who will likely be one of the Huskies’ top three-point threats, plus known as a fierce competitor with high basketball IQ… Figures to be in the mix for a starting spot in UConn’s lineup… As a senior, was named Big Ten co-Player of the Week… As a junior, named to All-Patriot League First Team and Academic All-Patriot League Team, also UConnTransfers to

As a Senior in 2022-23 (at Rutgers): and was Rutgers’ best shooter, hitting 44.4 percent overall and 43.4 percent from three-point range, as well as 89.4 percent from the foul line… Had 105 assists and 69 steals… Hit more three-pointers (72) than any Rutgers player in last 14 years… Hit game-winning three-pointer in victory at Purdue… Also hit game-winning trey in final minute, one of his 6 three-pointers, at Northwestern… Scored in double-figures in 24 games, including five games of 20+ points. team lead in scoring (13.2 ppg) Tied for Started all 34 games for the Scarlet Knights…

As a Junior in 2021-22 (at Loyola-Md.): in school’s single-season history… Scored in double figures in 28 games, including 12 20+ point games. thStarted all 30 games for Loyola… Led the Patriot League in scoring (18.9), steals (2.3) and minutes per game (37.0) and added 4.8 rebounds and 3.2 assists… Second in the conference in free throw percentage (.858) and second in assist-to-turnover ratio (2.4:1)… Shot .46.8 overall and .353 from three-point land… His 556 points ranked 17

As a Sophomore in 2020-21 (at Loyola-Md.): Played in season’s final five games, starting three, after missing the first 12 games with an injury… Averaged 10.2 points, 4.4 rebounds and 3.0 assists… Finished season with a 16-point, 7-rebound performance at Army in Patriot League Conference semifinal game.

As a Freshman in 2019-20 (at Loyola-Md.): Played 23 games and made 9 starts, but missed 9 games with an injury… Second on team in scoring (10.0 ppg) and led team in assists ((3.1)… At the time of his injury, was leading Division I in assist-to-turnover ratio (3.78:1)… Led team in three-point fg percentage (.436).

Before College: B-Conference honors... Honor roll student.All-MIAAand 4.5 assists per game and leading team to a 30-6 overall record and 15-2 in conference… Also named to Baltimore Sun’s All-Metro First Team and USA Today’s All-Maryland Second Team… Two-time conference All-Star… Also played varsity lacrosse as a junior and senior and was named All-Star Conference First Team as a senior… Played varsity golf as a freshman and earned Six-time letter winner at Boys’ Latin School of Maryland… Named 2019 Maryland Interscholastic Athletic Association Player of the Year after averaging 25.0 points, 7.0 rebounds
